intro: Lavatera arborea variegata, commonly known as the variegated tree mallows, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has palmate leaves with a distinctive variegated pattern of green and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
